page.title: 16The Worth Valley Railway
page.content: The railway line between{Keighley}and {Oxenhope}was originally built to bring coal and raw materials to the woollen mills and to distribute the finished products.The railway was particularly important just before and during the {First World War}but after{1920}road transport increased and the railways declined.In{1960,British Rail}closed the{Haworth}line and for 8 years it was unused.A group of enthusiasts negotiated to buy the line over a period of time.The amount is due to be paid off in{1992.}A society was formed:{The Keighley and Worth Valley {Railway Preservation Society,}to run steam trains on the 5 mile stretch of line.Everyone involved is an amateur. The drivers range from clergymen, probation officers,insurance salesmen to engineering lectures and craftsmen. They must undergo training and pass a
